content:
• Wednesday, June 18, 2014

  • After hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MEAS +10.3%. TVIX +9.7%. UVXY +9.3%. OUTR +4.2%. CLC +4.2%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: YPF -7.2%. VNET -6.4%. PETX -6.1%. AMTX -5.8%. SCTY -5.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • CLC

    Clarcor beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Clarcor (NYSE:CLC): FQ2 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $386.6M (+34.4% Y/Y) beats by $22.3M.
    • Shares +2.57% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • HCFT

    Five Oaks -3.3% on secondary offering

    • Five Oaks (OAKS) files to sell 3.5M shares in a secondary offering, with underwriters granted a greenshoe option of 525K shares.
    • At the regular session's close, the stock was selling for $11.89, a 7.4% discount to March 31 book value.
    • Shares are off 3.3% in after-hours action to $11.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • SDLP

    Seadrill Partners in 6.1M-unit public offering, $100M private placement

    • Seadrill Partners (NYSE:SDLP) -4.5% AH on news it plans a public offering of 6.1M common units; also, Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) agrees to purchase directly from SDLP at least $100M of common units via a private placement concurrent with the public offering.
    • SDRL plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, which may include acquisitions, repayment of indebtedness and working capital uses.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 21 Comments
  • RHT

    Red Hat +5.1% AH on FQ1 beat, deferred revenue strength

    • Red Hat's (NYSE:RHT) closely-watched deferred revenue balance grew 20% Y/Y in FQ1 to $1.27B. That's an improvement from FQ4's +18% and FQ3's +14%.
    • Subscription revenue (still 88% of total) +18% Y/Y vs. +16% in FQ4. Training/services revenue +9% vs. +8%. Red Hat once more says it closed a record number of $1M+ deals.
    • Opex +23% Y/Y (pressured EPS) vs. +15% in FQ4, thanks in part to a 24% increase in sales/marketing spend. $80M was spent on buybacks (boosted EPS).
    • CC at 5PM ET, guidance should be provided. FQ1 results, PR.
    • Earlier: Red Hat buying eNovance for $95M
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • TEL

    TE Connectivity buying Measurement Specialties for $1.7B

    • TE Connectivity (NYSE:TEL) is buying industrial sensor maker Measurement Specialties (NASDAQ:MEAS) for $86/share, or $1.7B after factoring net debt. The price represents a 10% premium to MEAS' Wednesday close.
    • With MEAS expecting FY15 (ends March '15) revenue of $540M, TE is paying 3.1x forward sales.
    • TE asserts the deal give it "a leadership position" in the sensor market, and allows it to offer "an unmatched range of connectivity and sensor solutions that are essential in a world where everything is increasingly connected."
    • The deal is expected to close by year's end, to be financed with both cash and debt, and to yield mid-single digit EPS accretion in its first year. TE forecasts double-digit post-merger growth for its sensor ops.
    • The purchase comes two months after a deal to buy underwater electrical connector firm Seacon for $490M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): Q1 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $423.75M (+16.7% Y/Y) beats by $9.78M.
    • Shares +3.58% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • CHFC

    Chemical Financial raising $70M in stock offering

    • At least part of the money raised will be used to help fund the bank's pending merger with Northwestern Bancorp.
    • CHFC -1.6% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • JBL

    Jabil Circuit beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ3 EPS of -$0.06 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $3.8B (-15.0% Y/Y) beats by $200M.
    • Shares +5.42% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • NEON

    Neonode -22.4%; SA author accuses company of "shell game"

    • Neonode (NASDAQ:NEON) has gone bankrupt twice and is "facing inevitable bankruptcy again," writes SA author The Pump Stopper in a very critical column.
    • The author calls Neonode's optical infrared touch technology "obsolete," "commoditized," and "the modern touchscreen equivalent of an '8-track' player," and deems the company to be a weak player even within the IR-touch niche.
    • The company's H-P printer deal is estimated to have produced only $154K in revenue, and the author suspects Neonode has lost Volvo as a client.
    • The Pump Stopper also states Swedish court docs (obtained through private investigators) have uncovered a lawsuit alleging chairman Per Bystedt is "involved in questionable shell companies, where he profited personally but investors were wiped out." A $0.00 price target is set.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 7 Comments
  • PED

    PEDEVCO +6% after gaining clearance to start Colorado drilling

    • PEDEVCO (PED +6.2%) moves sharply higher on news that Colorado energy authorities approved its plans to begin drilling at its recently acquired Wattenberg asset near Fort Collins.
    • PED plans to begin work by mid-August on three horizontal wells from a single pad, expecting to complete drilling in mid-October after reaching lateral lengths of 4K-5K ft. at a cost of ~$4.2M per well; the company expects to have a 45% working interest in each of the three new wells.
    • Overall, PED plans for up to 79 new horizontal wells comprising seven spacing units on the 6,700-acre Wattenberg field.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • RARE

    Ultragenyx initiates Phase 2 study of KRN23

    • Shares of recent IPO Ultragenyx Pharmaceutical (RARE +13.6%) jump on a 2x surge in volume on the news that it has initiated a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating its mAb KRN23 for the treatment of X-linked hypophosphatemia.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • PLUG

    Plug Power, fuel cell stocks skyrocket

    • Fuel cell companies had been quiet for a while but not today, as Plug Power (PLUG +18.8%) and Ballard Power (BLDP +15.8%) skyrocket amid speculation that declining volume and high short interest could be causing a short squeeze; others say the names have been trading at recent lows and may be catching a bid in response to the recent spike in solar stocks such as SolarCity.
    • FuelCell Energy (FCEL +1.2%) continues to gain after obtaining a federal grant, as the U.S. government pushes hydrogen energy to become a reality.
    • Also: ZBB +10.1%, HYG +0.4%, CPST -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 11 Comments

  • More from Yellen press conference

    • The decline in headline unemployment to 6.3% overstates the improvement in the labor market, says Yellen, explaining why the Fed plans on holding rates low even after the rate falls to 5.5%.
    • At least part of the decline in the rate represents what Yellen calls "shadow unemployment" - discouraged workers who have exited the labor force, but would return if prospects improved.
    • Markets are starting to take some direction, with the S&P 500 (SPY) now ahead 0.6% and the 10-year Treasury yield sinking four basis points to 2.61%.
    • Asked an interesting question about whether Fed policy is at odds with itself - with one hand, the Fed wants credit to flow to help boost the economy, but with the other hand is stifling credit with new regulations - Yellen says the boosted oversight is needed to prevent another financial crisis, and from her seat credit is broadly available.
    • Treasury ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, SHY, IEF, TBF, PST, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, IEI, TYO, DLBS, DTYS, VGLT, BIL, UST, UBT, TBX, SHV, VGIT, TLO, VGSH, SCHO, GSY, TENZ, ITE, DTYL, LBND, SCHR, TYD, SST, TYBS, DTUS, DTUL, TUZ, TBZ, DLBL, FIVZ, DFVL, DFVS, TYNS
    • Previous FOMC/Yellen coverage
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 13 Comments
  • AUMN

    Golden Minerals +26% on plans to restart Velardena

    • Golden Minerals (AUMN +26.3%) says it plans to restart mining at its Velardena properties in Mexico in July, sending shares soaring.
    • Once mining and processing are ramped up to ~285 metric tons/day of sulfide ore in mid-2015, AUMN expects output of 1M-1.2M million silver equiv. oz./year with cash costs of $12-$15 per silver oz.
    • AUMN expects to produce payable metals beginning in Q4 of ~150K oz. of silver equivalents, increasing to 275K oz./per quarter in mid-2015 when the ramp-up is completed.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM

  • Markets quiet after FOMC; await Yellen

    • Ten-year Treasury yields are whipping around a bit, but are currently about as they were ahead of the Fed announcement, down three basis points on the session at 2.62%. The shift in dots, however, showing a slightly earlier/faster pace of rate hikes has 2015 and 2016 Eurodollar futures lower by 2-3 points (suggesting a higher Fed Funds rate).
    • TLT +0.6%, TBT -1.2%
    • Stocks are slightly higher than they were pre-announcement, the S&P 500 (SPY) +0.3%.
    • Gold shows little reaction, up $1.50 per ounce to $1,273.50. GLD +0.25%
    • The dollar (UUP -0.2%), (UDN) remains as it was before the announcement.
    • Previously: Fed lowers 2014 GDP projection, but 2015 and 2016 hold
    • Previously: Fed sees slightly faster pace of rate hikes
    • Janet Yellen's press conference begins at 2:30 ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 4 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: INSM +40%. MEET +19%. BIOC +18%. LIVE +16%. RARE +13%. EXA +13%. ETRM +13%. GBR +13%. PLUG +11%. CCIH +11%.
    • Top 10 Losers: DOM -29%. ECYT -16%. CLRX -15%. CBPO -12%. VRS -12%. MTSL -11%. RXDX -10%. LZB -9%. CAG -8%. VDSI-OLD -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 5 Comments
  • UUUU

    Energy Fuels creates joint venture to maximize value of Copper King project

    • Uranium producer Energy Fuels (UUUU -1.7%) establishes a joint venture to focus on the development or sale of the company’s Copper King gold and copper project in Wyoming; Energy Fuels will own 50% of the new venture, with the rest held by a private investor group.
    • While gold and copper are not a core part of the company's uranium business, CEO Stephen Antony says it wants to retain a substantial interest in the project to realize the "significant expected benefits" of its future development or sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • HPJ

    Highpower +5.7% after shipping trial order to Costco

    • In an "initial trial order," Highpower (NASDAQ:HPJ) has completed delivery of  two containers of its Ni-MH rechargeable batteries to Costco. The batteries will be used as "power sources for general solar light products."
    • Highpower says it "manufactured the products for one of its branded customers with specific power requirements," and notes Ni-MH batteries are more environmentally friendly than the NiCD rechargeable batteries typically used for solar lighting.
    • Shares jumped in April following news of a supply deal with Sony involving the electronics giant's wireless products.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • CRZO

    Carrizo +3.3% on strong initial multiple-bench Niobrara downspacing results

    • Carizzo Oil & Gas (CRZO +3.3%) moves higher after reporting strong test results for its initial Niobrara A bench wells, which tested at an average peak 24-hour rate of 1,127 boe/day, including one well which tested at 1,633 boe/day.
    • CRZO recently began production from its first multiple geological bench downspacing pilot in the Niobrara formation, with the pilot consisting of eight wells.
    • The spudder rig has arrived on the location of CRZO's second Utica Shale well, and drilling is expected to begin shortly.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • DOM

    Dominion Resource Black Warrior Trust plummets on SA article

    • "DOM's wells are in their twilight years and Walter Energy has begun the process of abandoning them," writes The Forensic Accountant in an SA Pro article released from embargo this morning.
    • The company's own reserve report suggests the trust may have a lifetime of just 4-5 years, and this report combined with the article author's own analysis points to more than a 75% downside in the stock.
    • DOM -29.8%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk follows Adobe higher

    • Adobe beat May quarter estimates on the back of better-than-expected Creative Cloud subscriber growth, and also hiked its FY14 sub growth forecast. All of that is going over well with Autodesk (ADSK +3.8%) investors.
    • Autodesk's 3ds Max (3D modeling/rendering) and Maya (3D animation) software targets many of the same media/publishing firms Adobe sells Creative Cloud to. Moreover, Autodesk is undergoing a similar transition towards cloud/subscription-based revenue streams.
    • Previous: Autodesk buys 3D game engine developer
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy gets U.S. grant for distributed hydrogen production, +3%

    • FuelCell Energy (FCEL +3.1%) moves higher as the U.S. Department of Energy provides FCEL a $900K grant to produce a new system of distributed hydrogen production, part of $20M announced by the department to advance hydrogen production and delivery technologies.
    • The technology would allow hydrogen to be generated where it is needed rather than at larger plants, reducing transportation costs and greenhouse gases that are emitted through the process.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 4 Comments
  • MOBI

    Sky-mobi +8.6% after selling stake in game developer

    • Sky-mobi (NASDAQ:MOBI) has sold its 37.9% stake in Chinese mobile game developer Fangcun to local firm Guangdong Alpha Animation. The company realized an RMB56.4M ($9.1M) capital gain on the deal.
    • CEO Michael Tao Song declares Sky-mobi "closely collaborated" with Fangcun on the development/distribution of hit game MonsterxMonster, and says the mobile game publisher might invest in other game developers in the future.
    • Sky-mobi had $95M in cash at the end of Q1. It announced a $20M buyback on May 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • PEIX

    API says delays in setting ethanol mandates are "unacceptable"

    • Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +1.7%) ticks higher after the American Petroleum Institute express concern that the EPA may raise ethanol requirements from its 2014 proposal.
    • "Almost half of 2014 is behind us, yet EPA still hasn't finalized the ethanol requirements for this year," API says. "As the process continues to grind along, we are also concerned that EPA will raise ethanol requirements from its 2014 proposal, based on the specious reasoning that E85 - a mixture of up to 85 percent ethanol with 15 percent gasoline - is a workable solution. It is not."
    • Other relevant names are all lower: GPRE -1%, REGI -1.4%, BIOF -1.3%, REX -0.1%, ANDE -0.3%, ADM -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 8 Comments
  • CALL

    magicJack +6.3% after revamping mobile apps

    • magicJack's (NASDAQ:CALL) iOS/Android apps, re-branded under the magicApp name in April, give users the ability to make free 3G/4G and Wi-Fi-based calls to U.S./Canadian numbers, including from overseas locales. They can also be linked with landline magicJack numbers.
    • Registered users for magicJack's mobile apps rose 21% Q/Q in Q1 to 8.4M. At the same time, active magicJack subscribers fell by 100K to 3.1M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • FNF

    Fidelity National shareholders approve tracking stock

    • Fidelity National Financial Ventures (NYSE:FNFV) will track the performance of Fidelity National Financial's (FNF +1.9%) portfolio company investments.
    • At the time of closing (expected June 30), each share of FNF common will be converted into one share of FNF Group common stock and 0.3333 shares of FNFV Group common stock.
    • Activist investor Corvex Management should be pleased, having pushed for a way to realize more value from non-core businesses owned by Fidelity.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • ZBRA

    Zebra comes back to Earth

    • After soaring just before the close yesterday on what appears to have been a trading glitch, Zebra Technologies (ZBRA -3.1%) is trading roughly where it did before spiking higher.
    • The good news for longs: Shares are still up 44% YTD, and close to a 52-week high of $82.36.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • LIVE

    LiveDeal +17.3% after reporting restaurant sign-up growth

    • LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) states the number of restaurants registering for its deals platform on a daily basis is up over 400% over the last several months, thanks in part to a 35-city ad campaign.
    • LiveDeal rallied last Thursday after offering some details about the performance of its ad campaign, and on Friday after Priceline announced it's buying OpenTable.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • NEWL

    NewLead +43%, then halted, as court rules in favor of Ironridge

    • NewLead Holdings (NEWL +43.6%) is halted after institutional investor Ironridge Global IV says a U.S. District Court has ruled in its favor and rejected NEWL's claims on all issues, finding that Ironridge may appropriately instruct the transfer agent to deliver shares.
    • The judge also found that Ironridge has never engaged in short selling or manipulated NEWL's stock, and that Ironridge has no undisclosed brokerage relationships.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 6 Comments
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett +3.3% as seven more strong wells help boost production

    • Bill Barrett (BBG +3.3%) opens to solid gains after an updated investor presentation reveals strong results for seven wells in the Niobrara, with initial production rates of 850 boe/day and 30-day rates of 437 boe/day, which are slightly ahead of the play average for BBG of 430 boe/day.
    • Wunderlich notes the presentation doesn't state which formations the wells targeted (though it looks like Niobrara B, C, and Codell targets), but the results provide added confidence in the assets and help boost the average extension well from 423 boe/day on a 30-day rate to 430 boe/day (Briefing.com).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • HTZ

    Hertz Global in focus

    • Hertz Global (HTZ +2.7%) trades higher in early action.
    • The company is the subject of a lot of debate with accounting issues in the mix and activist investors antsy.
    • Despite all the drama, shares of Hertz are only down 2.3% over the last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • NMBL

    Nimble +8.1%; Morgan Stanley upgrades following management talks

    • Morgan Stanley's Katy Huberty has upgraded Nimble Storage (NYSE:NMBL) to Overweight, and also hiked her revenue estimates above consensus. Her PT is at $38.
    • Recent talks with management suggested new products will boost Nimble's enterprise penetration, that the company's moat is "intact and sustainable," and that its gross margin remains stable.
    • Piper and William Blair have noted the pending arrival of Fibre Channel support could boost Nimble's enterprise uptake; the company heavily depends on SMBs for now. Blair also sees adoption of Nimble's scale-out storage software boosting its enterprise fortunes.
    • Macquarie and Raymond James have already upgraded Nimble following its June 11 lockup expiration.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • NBBC

    NewBridge stung by downgrade

    • NewBridge Bancorp (NBBC -4.1%) cools a bit from a nice recent run after KBW cashes in its chips on its Outperform rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • SPWR

    SunPower falls on JPMorgan downgrade

    • Arguing shares are fully valued following a 35% YTD run-up, JPMorgan has cut SunPower (SPWR -3.3%) to Neutral. Its PT is at $40.
    • Yesterday, SunPower took part in a a solar rally sparked by SolarCity and Yingli. Shares go for 23x 2015E EPS, and 1.8x 2015E sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 7 Comments
  • BEN

    BEN boosted by Goldman upgrade

    • "We believe year-to-date underperformance (about 400 bps vs. peers) offers a good entry point," says analyst Marc Irizarry, upgrading Franklin Resources (BEN +1.5%) to a Buy with price target lifted by $10 to $63.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • MEET

    MeetMe +8.8% on Wunderlich coverage launch

    • Wunderlich's Blake Harper has launched coverage of MeetMe (NASDAQ:MEET) with a Buy and $4.50 PT.
    • Harper: "We expect the company to increase the number of mobile active users, their monetization levels, and its FY15 revenues above the consensus through enhancements to its core app, its mobile advertising deals, and broader trends with younger people sharing content via mobile apps."
    • He admits MeetMe's high churn rates yield an "elevated risk profile," but thinks that's baked into the valuation. His PT is equal to 3x EV/2015E sales, assuming 20% 2015 revenue growth.
    • Previous: MeetMe rises after reporting record traffic
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: INSM +29%. ETRM +15%. MEET +13%. ZLCS +13%. LIVE +8%. ADBE +9%. RGSE +8%. APD +6%.
    • Losers: ECYT -15%. LZB -11%. GDP -8%. NGL -6%. GWPH -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • CAG

    Chef Boyardee takes the rap for ConAgra's profit slip

    • ConAgra (NYSE:CAG) singled out Chef Boyardee as a brand which is cutting into the company's overall profitability due to weak demand.
    • A non-cash impairment charge of $681M is being taken in FQ4 due to the brand's slide in relevance and goodwill.
    • CAG -4.9% premarket to $31.24.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM | 3 Comments
  • ECYT

    Endocyte set for opening gap down

    • Shares of Endocyte (NASDAQ:ECYT) are down 14% premarket on heavy volume in response to Merck's exit from vintafolide.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • RAI

    Analysis: Lorillard-Reynolds American deal is not if but when

    • Wells Fargo analyst Bonnie Herzog is fairly confident (90%) that a deal in which Reynolds American (NYSE:RAI) pays up to $80 per share for Lorillard (NYSE:LO) is still likely (CNBC interview video).
    • Herzog thinks a combination of the two companies will "catapult" the e-cigarette business.
    • LO +2.0% premarket to $63.01 giving investors plenty of upside still if the Wells call is correct.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 3 Comments
  • GPS

    Analysis: Gap's initiatives to pay off

    • Gap (NYSE:GPS) is upgraded by Canaccord Genuity to a Buy rating from Hold.
    • The investment firm is confident the apparel seller can boost margins through new initiatives.
    • GPS +0.9% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • INSM

    BTD status for Arikayce

    • The FDA designates Insmed's (NASDAQ:INSM) Arikayce (liposomal amikacin) a Breakthrough Therapy for the treatment of adult patients with nontuberculous mycobacterial lung disease who are treatment refractory. The company plans to meet with the agency to discuss a regulatory pathway for the product.
    • Shares are up 28% premarket on heavy volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • LULU

    Slide in Lululemon fires up takeover talk

    • Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) are higher in premarket trading off of a Bloomberg report indicating Adidas (OTCQX:ADDYY) or V.F. Corp (NYSE:VFC) might be interested in buying the company out.
    • A 34% YTD decline in Lulu's share price has brought questions on fair valuation back to the forefront.
    • Though the forward P-E ratio on Lululemon hasn't been lower since 2009, missteps by management and new competition has taken some of the bloom off the rose.
    • LULU +1.2% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 2 Comments
  • CAG

    ConAgra lower after warning on FQ4 profit

    • ConAgra (NYSE:CAG) warns it will miss analyst estimates with its FQ4 report.
    • The company sees FQ4 EPS of $0.55 vs. $0.62 consensus.
    • A drop in volume of 7% for ConAgra's consumer foods segment is partially responsible for the profit slip.
    • CAG -3.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    Amazon Appstore to be available on BlackBerry 10 phones

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) Appstore will be available with the launch of the BlackBerry (BBRY) 10.3 operating system this fall.
    • BlackBerry has about 130K apps, but is missing key ones like Pinterest, Netflix, and Groupon, all of which Amazon - with roughly 240K apps - has access to.
    • "I do not have to spend time, energy and money" developing apps Amazon offers, says CEO John Chen. "Given I want to financially turn around the company and focus on the enterprise space, this is perfect for us."
    • BBRY +3.5% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 32 Comments
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods upgraded by KeyCorp

    • KeyCorp upgrades Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) to a Buy rating from Neutral.
    • The profile of the entire food sector has been lifted with M&A activity picking up.
    • DMND +1.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM
  • CBI

    Chicago Bridge responds to attack

    • "CBI's management team operates our company with the absolute highest integrity, and we take great issue with erroneous claims such as these," says CEO Philip K. Asherman. The company notes the author of the negative report is likely short the stock and thus urges readers to view the conclusions skeptically.
    • Q2 results are set for release in late July, and CB&I expects them to be within the ranges of previously issued guidance.
    • DA Davidson upgrades the stock to a Buy from Neutral, citing valuation.
    • Previously: Chicago Bridge & Iron slips on "creative accounting" allegation
    • Shares +1.1% premarket after yesterday's 7.2% decline.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM | 9 Comments
  • WBA

    Barclays taps Walgreen for outsized gains

    • Barclays upgrades Walgreen (WAG) to Overweight from Equalweight.
    • The integration of Alliance Boots into Walgreen and the potential for a tax inversion transaction give analysts plenty of meat to chew on.
    • The investment firm has a $92 price target on shares.
    • WAG +3.1% premarket ti $75.38.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:26 AM | 2 Comments
  • ARGT

    S&P downgrades Argentina to CCC-

    • Argentina's long-term foreign currency rating of CCC+ has been lowered by Standard & Poor's to CCC-, due to an increased risk of default on the country's foreign currency debt.
    • Earlier this week, alarm bells were sounded when President Cristina Fernandez said the country cannot pay the $1.5B it owes by the end of the month, following a U.S. Supreme Court ruling.
    • However, S&P affirmed the country's short-term foreign currency rating at C, saying that court ruling was not likely to affect the government's service on local currency debt.
    • ETFs: ARGT
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 AM | 1 Comment
